citations.narrative:
The perimeter fence behind the enclosure housing 3 fennec fox is less than 3 feet from the enclosure. Perimeter fences
are necessary to protect the animals in the facility by restricting animals and unauthorized persons from going through it
or under it and having contact with the animals. It should also serve as a secondary containment system for the animals
housed within. Perimeter fences less than 3 feet in distance from the primary enclosure must be approved in writing by
the Administrator.
Correct by May 4, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n
